intro: Quercus pedemontana, commonly known as the Pedemontan oak, is a deciduous tree native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Fagaceae family and is characterized by its broad, lobed leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The tree produces small, spiny acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Its ecological significance makes it a valuable component of local biodiversity.
